intro: Anchusa adami, commonly known as the pink anchusa, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and branched. Anchusa adami is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
